sentences.en: 1/4 cup crumbled goat’s cheese
sentences.cn: 四分之一杯山羊奶酪碎

sentences.en: As I crumble this earth, I get smaller and smaller pieces.
sentences.cn: 当我把泥土弄碎时, 我获得了越来越小的土粒.

sentences.en: Brighton have too many experienced players to crumble just because we are in town.
sentences.cn: 布赖顿队有很多经验丰富的队员，他们不会因为我们在城里就丧失斗志。

sentences.en: crumbling colonial buildings
sentences.cn: 逐渐坍塌的殖民时期建筑

sentences.en: Don't crumble your bread on the table.
sentences.cn: 不要把面包碎屑弄到桌子上.

sentences.en: Even if the seas go dry and rocks crumble , my will will remain firm.
sentences.cn: 纵然海枯石烂, 意志永不动摇.

sentences.en: Even these hard parts may crumble to dust.
sentences.cn: 甚至这些坚硬的部分也会破碎成粉末.

sentences.en: He is a skilled and ruthless leader who isn't likely to crumble under pressure.
sentences.cn: 他是个经验丰富、冷酷无情的领导，不会被压力击垮。

sentences.en: It only takes a minute for the football hopes of an entire country to crumble.
sentences.cn: 就在一分钟之内，全国民众的足球梦想就化为了泡影。

sentences.en: our crumbling economy
sentences.cn: 我们正在衰退的经济

sentences.en: Rice flour makes the cake less likely to crumble.
sentences.cn: 这种糕饼用米粉做不那么容易碎。

sentences.en: Roughly crumble the cheese into a bowl.
sentences.cn: 把干酪大致弄碎，装入一只碗内。

sentences.en: She felt her assurance crumble.
sentences.cn: 她感觉到自己不能自持.

sentences.en: Since papyrus dries up and crumble, very few documents of ancient Egypt have survived.
sentences.cn: 因草片会干裂成粉末所以古埃及的文件很少保存下来.

sentences.en: Take two identical sheet of paper and crumble one of them into a small ball.
sentences.cn: 取两张相同的纸,把其中之一捏成小球.

sentences.en: The Empire began to crumble during the 13th century.
sentences.cn: 这个帝国在13世纪时开始崩溃。

sentences.en: The fall leaves crumbled in my fingers.
sentences.cn: 秋叶在我指间碎裂了。

sentences.en: The masonry of the old building began to crumble.
sentences.cn: 旧楼房的砖石结构开始崩落.

sentences.en: The old stonework was crumbling away.
sentences.cn: 古老的石筑部分逐渐崩塌。

sentences.en: The wrinkling of the hills would make them crumble.
sentences.cn: 这些山峦的皱摺会使它们倒塌无遗.

sentences.en: To pass the water test the catalyst should not disintegrate or crumble.
sentences.cn: 经过泡水试验,催化剂应不开裂或破碎.

sentences.en: Under the pressure, the flint crumbled into fragments.
sentences.cn: 在压力作用下，燧石裂成了碎片。

trans.tran_en: to break apart into lots of little pieces, or make something do this
to lose power, become weak, or fail
if something, especially something made of stone or rock, is crumbling, small pieces are breaking off it
